section.name: Introduction
section.p: DNA is a lightweight Inversion of Control (IOC) framework. It defines the way that you write components so that they can be hosted in DNA-compliant containers.

DNA has gone through three major revisions. The first version of DNA (1.0) defined the programming contract for DNA-compliant components. Version 1.1 of DNA tightened the programming contract and defined the information model for metadata associated with components. The metadata was bound to the components using the MetaClass toolkit. Version 1.2 of DNA uses the JDK 1.5 Annotation framework to bind the metadata to the components.

Each revision has seen the development of DNA-compliant components simplified and we recomend you upgrade to the latest DNA version. However we recognize that not all users are ready to use JDK 1.5 and thus we still maintain the version 1.1 of DNA.
